Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Ranpak Holdings Corp. (NYSE: PACK) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $4.31 (closing price as of October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and NYSE data)  
**Market Capitalization:** $348.2 million (as of October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $3.43 - $10.54  
**Sources:** Latest data from Ranpak Q2 2024 earnings (August 1, 2024, via SEC 10-Q and earnings call transcript on Seeking Alpha/Company IR); Q3 2024 guidance from August 1 call; recent articles (e.g., Packaging Dive, Aug 2, 2024; Yahoo Finance, Oct 2024 updates); Reddit/WallStreetBets discussions (neutral volume, focus on sustainability); X/Twitter sentiment (positive on e-comm growth, ~70% bullish per StockTwits Oct 2024); analyst notes (e.g., Craig-Hallum "Buy" reiterate Oct 2, 2024).

## Company Overview (187 words)
Ranpak Holdings Corp. (PACK) is a global leader in sustainable, paper-based protective packaging solutions, primarily serving the e-commerce, industrial supply chain, and consumer goods sectors. Founded in 1972 and headquartered in Concord Township, Ohio, Ranpak designs, manufactures, and sells dispensers and paper-based consumables that replace plastic alternatives for void-fill, cushioning, and wrapping. Its products reduce packaging waste by up to 80% compared to foam or air pillows, aligning with global sustainability mandates (e.g., EU plastic bans). Operating in North America (~60% revenue), Europe (~35%), and Asia (~5%), Ranpak's automated machines like AutoBob and PadPak integrate into high-volume fulfillment centers. In Q2 2024, the company reported revenue of $96.1 million (+6% YoY), driven by e-commerce demand and machine placements (179 net new in H1 2024). With a focus on recurring revenue from consumables (85-90% of sales), Ranpak targets a $10B+ total addressable market (TAM) in paper cushioning, positioning itself as a key enabler of circular economy transitions amid rising ESG pressures.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 1, 2024):** Revenue $96.1M (+6% YoY); Consumables $78.6M (+8%); Net income $3.7M (vs. $0.3M prior); Adjusted EBITDA $20.4M (21.2% margin). 179 net new dispensers installed in H1.
- **Q3 2024 Guidance (Aug 1, 2024):** Revenue $94-98M; Adjusted EBITDA $18-20M.
- **Stock Repurchase (Sep 2024):** Expanded program by $20M (total authorization $40M), signaling confidence.
- **Sustainability Recognition (Oct 3, 2024):** Named to Newsweek's "America's Most Responsible Companies 2025" list.
- **Online Buzz:** Reddit r/investing threads (Sep-Oct 2024) highlight undervaluation post-Q2 beat; X discussions focus on EU expansion amid plastic regulations.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Pillars:** Accelerate machine placements (target 400-500 annually), boost consumables yield per machine (up 5-10% via software), expand into underpenetrated regions/markets.
- **Automation Push:** Rollout of next-gen AutoBob Pro (Q4 2024 pilot), increasing throughput 2x.
- **Geographic Expansion:** +20% Europe growth targeted FY2024; Asia entry via JV (announced Jun 2024).
- **Recurring Revenue Focus:** 85%+ from consumables; lifetime value per machine ~$500K.

## Headwinds & Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong consumables pricing (+5% Q2); 95% customer retention; ESG leadership (carbon-neutral by 2025 goal). | Industrial slowdown (e.g., automotive OEM exposure down 10% YoY Q2); FX headwinds in Europe (-2% revenue impact). |
| **Sector (Protective Packaging, $15B TAM)** | Sustainability regulations (EU Single-Use Plastics Directive Phase 2, Jul 2024); E-comm surge (+15% global shipments 2024 per Statista); Plastic-to-paper shift (40% converters by 2027 per McKinsey). | Macro slowdown (US industrial production -0.5% Sep 2024 per Fed data); Competitor pricing pressure; Supply chain inflation (paper costs +3% Q2). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Dispensers:** AutoBob (void-fill), PadPak (cushioning), SlidePak (underlay), StabilPak (edge protection).
- **Consumables:** Recycled paper rolls (Fanfold, CutPaper).
- **Services:** Installation, maintenance, yield optimization software.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **AutoBob Pro (Pilot Q4 2024):** AI-driven, 2x faster void-fill; full rollout H1 2025.
- **WrapPak (Development, ETA 2025):** Automated wrapping for fragile goods.
- **Asia JV (Launched Jun 2024):** With local partner for China manufacturing hub.
- **Digital Platform (Beta Q3 2024):** IoT analytics for predictive maintenance, targeting +15% yield.

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Market Share:** ~25-30% in North American paper cushioning (per Ranpak IR, 2023; Packaging Strategies report Jul 2024); ~15% Europe.
- **Forecast:** +2-4% annual growth to 35% NA by 2026, driven by 20% TAM CAGR (sustainability shift); Potential decline risk to 22% if industrial weakens (per Aug 2024 earnings call).

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (FY2023 unless noted) | PACK | Sealed Air (SEE) | Pregis | DS Smith (SMDSY) |
|------------------------------|------|-------------------|--------|-------------------|
| **Revenue** | $414M | $5.4B | ~$1B (est.) | €11B (packaging total) |
| **Paper Cushioning Focus** | 100% | 20% (Bubble Wrap dominant) | 60% | 10% |
| **Sustainability Edge** | Leader (100% paper) | Transitioning | Strong | Broad portfolio |
| **EV/EBITDA** | 8.5x (fwd) | 10x | N/A | 6x |
| **YTD Stock Perf.** | -45% | -20% | N/A | +5% |
| **Notes** | Pure-play growth | Scale advantage | Private, M&A target | Diversified headwinds |

PACK leads in sustainability but lags scale; outperforms on margins (20% EBITDA vs. SEE 18%).

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** UPS (multi-year e-comm pilot, 2023); Grainger (expanded 2024); EU logistics firms (e.g., DHL trials Q3 2024).
- **M&A:** None recent; Acquired FFCT (wrapping tech) in 2021; Watching tuck-ins in Asia (earnings call hint, Aug 2024).
- **Major Clients (10-15% each):** MSC Industrial, Fastenal, Grainger, W.W. Grainger (NA); Würth Group (Europe).
- **Potential Clients:** Amazon (testing phase per Oct 2024 rumors on LinkedIn); Home Depot expansion pilots.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management:** CEO Agustin Azubel (ex-P&G) lauded for execution (earnings call sentiment).
- **ESG Score:** 75/100 (Sustainalytics, Sep 2024); Net Promoter Score 70+.
- **Risks:** 0.6x Net Debt/EBITDA (healthy); Insider ownership 15%.
- **Sentiment:** Analyst consensus "Buy" (4 Buys, avg PT $8.50 per MarketBeat Oct 2024).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy). Strong growth from sustainability tailwinds and consumables moat outweigh macro headwinds; undervalued at 8x fwd EBITDA vs. peers 10x+. Suitable for moderate risk/growth portfolios (e-comm exposure ~40%).
- **Fair Value Estimate:** $8.00 (85% upside). Based on 12x 2025E EBITDA ($45M est. per guidance extrapolation) + 20% TAM growth premium; DCF supports $7.50-9.00 (10% IRR, per analyst models like Craig-Hallum Oct 2 PT $10). Hold below $4.50; Buy aggressively sub-$4.00.
